noun.description: An instruction written by a medical practitioner that authorizes a patient to be provided a medicine or treatment.
examples: he scribbled a prescription for tranquilizers

noun.description: A recommendation that is authoritatively put forward.
examples: effective prescriptions for sustaining rural communities

noun.description: The establishment of a claim founded on the basis of a long or indefinite period of uninterrupted use or of long-standing custom.

origin: Late Middle English (as a legal term): via Old French from Latin praescriptio(n-), from the verb praescribere (see prescribe). prescription (sense 1) dates from the late 16th century.
